source_docs.MSFT_FY23_REPORT: For the fiscal year ending June 30, 2023, Microsoft's Cloud division reported revenues of $82.5 billion. The company employed 221,000 people at the end of this fiscal year.
source_docs.MSFT_FY22_REPORT: For the fiscal year ending June 30, 2022, Microsoft's Cloud division reported revenues of $71.4 billion. The number of employees at the end of fiscal 2022 was 218,000.
source_docs.ACQUISITION_ANNOUNCEMENT: Microsoft officially completed its acquisition of Nuance Communications on March 4, 2022. The deal was valued at $19.7 billion.

qa_item.question: Calculate the year-over-year revenue growth for Microsoft's Cloud division for the fiscal year that ended AFTER the Nuance Communications acquisition was completed. Provide the answer in billions of dollars.

filler_text.irrelevant: Global markets saw a surge in commodity prices today, with copper reaching a new high. The tech sector remained flat as investors await the upcoming jobs report. Federal employment dropped 15,000 jobs...
filler_text.relevant_masked: Analysts noted that Microsoft's R&D spending, which reached [REDACTED_VALUE] in FY2023, reflects its major investments in AI and cloud infrastructure following the Activision Blizzard deal announcement...

distractor_task.task: You are presented with four cards on a table. Each card has a letter on one side and a number on the other. The cards show: A, D, 3, 7. Your task is to determine which card(s) you must turn over to test the rule: 'If a card has a vowel on one side, then it must have an even number on the other side.' Explain your reasoning.
